lps.pr2
Class Room

java.lang.Object
  lps.pr2.Room

public class Room
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a room in the adventure game. Every room has no more than 4 doors and contains a textual description about itself.

The rooms can also contain items that the player can pick and drop. Each item have a unique name, that is, it is not allowed to be two different items with the same name in a room.

_doors

protected java.util.EnumMap<Parser.Direction,Room> _doors
Adjacent rooms. It there will be a room in every direction (NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST). If _doors.get(X) == null then there is not any adjacent room in direction X

isClosed

public boolean isClosed(Parser.Direction d)
Checks if there is any adjacent room in the given direction

Parameters:
d - The direction to check
Returns:
  • true if the door is closed (there is not any room) in the given direction
  • false, otherwise

    • nextRoom

    public Room nextRoom(Parser.Direction d)
    Returns the adjacent room connected in the given direction. If there is not any connected room, it returns null

    Parameters:
    d - The direction to check
    Returns:
    The room connected with this one in the provided direction. If the door in this direction is closed (it is not connected to any room in this direction) it returns null

    toString

    public java.lang.String toString()
    Returns the room description

    Overrides:
    toString in class java.lang.Object
    See Also:
    Object.toString()

    findItem

    public Item findItem(java.lang.String name)
    Finds an item in the room. The item is identified by its name. If there is not any item with this name it returns null. This method returns a reference of the item but it does not remove the item from the room

    Parameters:
    name - Name of the item to be found
    Returns:
    A reference to the item identified by the name. It returns null if there is not any item identified with this name

    pickItem

    public Item pickItem(java.lang.String name)
    Picks an item identified by its name from the room. If there is not an item with this name it returns null. Otherwise, it returns the item and this one is removed from the room.

    Parameters:
    name - Name of the item to be picked
    Returns:
    The item identified by the name. It returns null if there is not any item identified by this name

    dropItem

    public boolean dropItem(Item it)
    Drops an item in this room. We can drop an item if there is not any item with the same name in this room. If the operation is performed, the room will contain the dropped item

    Parameters:
    it - The item to be dropped
    Returns:
  • True if we can drop the item (and the item appears in the room)
  • False, otherwise

    • putItem

    public void putItem(Item it)
    Puts an item in a room. This method is only employed for creating the room. It does not check whether the room contains another object with the same name. If there is an item, the former is replaced with the new item.

    Do not use this method to drop an item

    Parameters:
    it - The item that the room will store.

    showRoomInventory

    public java.lang.String showRoomInventory()
    Returns a String with all Room items

    Returns:
    All room items
